title: Robyn Hitchcock - Partial Discography 1979-2009
description:
ROBYN HITCHCOCK - Partial FLAC Discography from my private collection . . . 
30 Years of Hitchcock! Everyone is a fan of somebody whose progress through life makes the fan feel old. In my case, that person is Robyn Hitchcock. I remember when hardly anyone in America had heard of him. And he's been recording for almost 35 years. Amazing.

The CDs in this set are:

1) The Soft Boys - A Can of Bees 1979 (Rykodisc)

2) Black Snake Diamond Role 1981 (Rhino)

3) I Often Dream of Trains 1984 (Rhino)

4) Perspex Island 1991 (A&M) - with The Egyptians

5) The Kershaw Sessions 1994 (Strange Roots Records)- a compilation of recordings made strictly for BBC broadcast - with The Egyptians

6) Jewels for Sophia 1999 (Warner Brothers)

7) Goodnight Oslo 2009 (Yep Roc Records) - with Venus 3

The first 3 discs in the series include bonus tracks. 

I Often Dream of Trains in CD form is LADEN with bonus tracks - the original vinyl LP included tracks 1-7 and 13-19, and while I enjoy some of the additions on the CD the original 14 track LP was more severe and interesting.

Jewels for Sophia has a hidden song at the end of the last track - wait for it.
